instruction: The input is taken from a negotiation between two participants who take the role of campsite neighbors and negotiate for Food, Water, and Firewood packages, based on their individual preferences and requirements. Given an utterance and recent dialogue context containing past 3 utterances (wherever available), output Yes if the utterance contains the vouch-fair strategy, otherwise output No. vouch-fair is a selfish negotiation strategy. It is used to call out fairness for personal benefit, either when acknowledging a fair deal or when the opponent offers a deal that benefits them. This can be through an explicit call out or can be implied.
input:
Context: 'In a perfect world, all the water 🙂' 'that won't be fair, how about I get 1 water, 3 food and 1 firewood, that way u get the most water' 'Interesting.  If I decided to forgo water completely, would you accept giving me everything else?'
Utterance: 'no, at the most i can do is i get 2 water, 2 food and 0 firewood or I get 1 water, 3 food and 1 firewood'

instruction: The input is taken from a negotiation between two participants who take the role of campsite neighbors and negotiate for Food, Water, and Firewood packages, based on their individual preferences and requirements. Given an utterance and recent dialogue context containing past 3 utterances (wherever available), output Yes if the utterance contains the vouch-fair strategy, otherwise output No. vouch-fair is a selfish negotiation strategy. This can be through an explicit call out or can be implied.
input:
Context: 'I was planning on staying up all night and keeping my fire going all night.  Honestly I could give you all the extra food if that helps you if I could please have the 3 firewood?  We could split the waters' 'I'll only give you all the firewood if you give me everything else. I know it's your top priority😮' 'How about I take all the wood, give you all the food, you can have 2 waters and I can have one.  Having a little extra water will help me with all the hiking we will be doing, plus since i wont be eating much I want to stay hydrated.  Will that work for you>>🙂'
Utterance: 'cringe ☹️. Ill take one firewood and two of both water and food '

input:
Context: 'You don't have to eat the poison mushrooms. You can catch some fish from the river or hunt for small animals.  You have all of the firewood so cooking the food should not be a problem.' 'I won't willingly eat the poisonous mushrooms, but it could be very hard to tell the difference from safe and toxic ones.  I understand you will be staying in your area for a few extra days, but can you catch fish or hunt for small animals in your area too?' 'I do not have any extra firewood to do so.☹️  So if I can keep 1 package of firewood so I hunt and cook the fish.  I will give you 1 package of the food.'
Utterance: 'I would be willing to give up 1 package of the firewood to you for 1 package of the food.  '

Context: 
Utterance: 'Hello, how is your camping trip going?'

instruction: The input is taken from a negotiation between two participants who take the role of campsite neighbors and negotiate for Food, Water, and Firewood packages, based on their individual preferences and requirements. input:
Context: 'understood, I can give you 1 firewood, 2 food, and 2 water to make your trip better.' 'Hm. I''ll definitely take you up on the water, thanks for that. The thing is, I have low blood pressure, and I have trouble regulating my body temperature so I am frequently cold. How about if I take two firewood, and the two waters. It sounds like you are going to do a lot of cooking, so you can take two of the food.  ' 'Will you take two firewood, 1 food, and 1 water?'
Utterance: 'I don't want to take too much food, I want you to be able to enjoy all the cooking you are going to do🙂! But I would like two waters--I'd be afraid of dehydrating on my trip. I'd even throw in the extra food! that would give you all three! you could really do some cooking then! '

Context: 'Sure you can give me firewood in place of water' 'Thank you 🙂 That works for me. I'm also in my first trimester so I'll need a bit of extra food since I'm feeding my little one. Is that alright with you?' 'Woah... You can take more food as well'
Utterance: 'Thank you dear! :D I really appreciate that. Are you okay with how everything is divided up then?'

Have lots of people coming.' 'I'm not as keen on food, so how does this sound.  I get 2 firewood, 2 waters, and 1 food.  You will get 2 food, 1 firewood, and 1 water. '
Utterance: 'Hmm, you're getting my top item there though. That still might work.'
